creditline: Gift of Bruce B. Dayton and Samuel H. Maslon
description: Two-volume set in dark brown textured cloth slip case. Two folio volumes: Volume One (bound) contains 80 pages of Albers\' text. Volume Two contains 80 double-page color screenprints loosely inserted into a series of paper folders. They are arranged to show the effects a range of colours have on each other. Together with these is a 48-page bound \'Commentary\' book in plain black wraps. Among the \'authors\' of the screenprints is the US poet Mark Strand, a pupil of Albers who contributes two prints. The two volumes are also bound in dark brown textured cloth.
image_copyright: %26Acirc%3B%26copy%3BEstate Josef Albers %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
title: Interaction of Color
